Author: Jcharming#2693
Content:
I'm curious how the HyperDex/BarterDex project is coming along.  Recently I was commenting on it in a reddit thread basically praising KMD and it's team for their work on this DEX system and someone asked 'What's the latest, when can I use it?  Vaporware?"  so I figured it was time to come back and get an update myself.  
I participated in the soft launch a couple months ago and I see recently there is GUSD integration.  
Is there someone that would be willing to just give me an update as to where it is, and what it's next time line is looking like?   Please and thank you for anyone that does.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: HyperDex devs have voiced concern over less than optimal order matching and have been trying to fully assess where the problem may be. There‚Äôs been some question about the success rate of order matching lately, so that‚Äôs an outstanding question if it‚Äôs working optimally with respect to the current version of marketmaker, which is the underlying engine behind BarterDex.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Markermaker2.0 is apparently in the works, which seeks to improve the order match success rate (amongst other things)  It‚Äôll be completely rewritten in RUST, made more optimal/extendable for more devs to jump on onboard. They‚Äôre aiming to get a beta out Q1 2019 afaik. Don‚Äôt know how far along they are.

Author: Jcharming#2693
Content: Thanks for a quick update @tolken   I really appreciate it, so atm is it fair to say that Hyper/BarterDex's are not functional until MM2.0 gets finished?

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: Hyper/BarterDex have been working since almost a year

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: just not noob friendly, there's some learning curve

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: Hyperdex is easier though

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: mm2.0 should fix the core and also help improving the ux

Author: Jcharming#2693
Content: So atm would you recommend people that are looking for a real dex to look into and learn how to use BarterDex or to wait out for hyperdex functionality with MM2?

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: depends on their skill level,  for average users it's probably hard to use, even if tolken is providing volume for the main pairs. Skilled users can even use command line or learn to become marketmakers in anticipation of 2.0

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: it was to be expected for the first iteration, in time it will get better

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: I've read Chainzilla is working on a dashboard to help do marketmakers, the more there are and the easier it will be trading

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: so if the question is if this can be widely adopted right now, I'd say it's not for the masses (yet) but it's a matter of time

Author: crumb#2550

Author: javadth#4536
Content: hi

Author: javadth#4536
Content: whats the hyperdex ?

Author: javadth#4536
Content: a in-software exchange ?

Author: javadth#4536
Content: its a wallet ?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: HyperDEX is a very simple exchange app which uses decentralized, atomic swap technology (BarterDEX) and does contain basic wallet features like send and withdraw.

Author: javadth#4536
Content: so it can be used like a wallet ?

Author: javadth#4536
Content: its online or offline ?

Author: tolken#2655
Content: @javadth  Yes, can be used as a wallet. Can trade when you‚Äôre online, not when offline. Same limitations as regular wallet.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: The wallet part of the functionality it's similar to Agama , it lets you access a specific address because you have the seed ...but your funds are in the blockchain not in the software The seed that you use gives you access to this specific address the same way as if you had the private keys for an specific address in the blockchain.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Eventually, we would want to build all the agama functionality into HyperDEX so it is a one stop shop.
